title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
story: In the roaring twenties, Nick Carraway arrives in Long Island, New York, to begin a new chapter of his life. He rents a small house next to the opulent mansion of the enigmatic Jay Gatsby, a millionaire known for his lavish parties. Gatsby, however, seems distant from his guests, quietly yearning for Daisy Buchanan, Nick's cousin and Gatsby's lost love. Daisy, married to Tom Buchanan, lives across the bay, and her green dock light becomes a symbol of Gatsby's longing. Nick becomes a confidant to Gatsby and learns of his humble beginnings and his rise to wealth in a bid to win Daisy back. Through Nick's narration, we see the world of excess, shallow relationships, and the decay of the American Dream. As Gatsby and Daisy rekindle their romance, tensions mount. A tragic chain of events unfolds when Tom's mistress, Myrtle, is accidentally killed in a car accident involving Gatsby's car. Tom manipulates Myrtle's husband into believing Gatsby is to blame, leading to Gatsby's tragic death. In the aftermath, Nick reflects on the fleeting nature of dreams and the hollowness of the era. Despite Gatsby's flaws, Nick sees him as a man with an extraordinary capacity for hope.
